criteria: Identification of Theme or Central Idea
descriptions: The student does not identify a theme or central idea.
The student struggles to identify a theme or central idea, offering vague or inaccurate suggestions.
The student identifies a theme or central idea, but it is simplistic or not fully supported by the text.
The student identifies a relevant theme or central idea of the text.
The student accurately identifies a significant theme or central idea of the text and provides some supporting evidence.
The student accurately identifies a sophisticated and insightful theme or central idea, providing strong textual evidence to support their claim.
The student provides no analysis of the theme's development.
The student attempts to analyze the theme's development, but the analysis is unclear or irrelevant.
The student provides a basic analysis of the theme's development, mentioning its connection to the plot, setting or characters, but lacks depth.
The student analyzes the theme's development over the course of the text, connecting it to the plot, setting, and/or characters.
The student analyzes the theme's development with specific examples of its relationship to the characters, setting, and plot.
The student provides a comprehensive and insightful analysis of the theme's development, clearly articulating its complex relationship to the characters, setting, and plot.
The student fails to provide a summary of the text or provides a summary that is highly subjective or inaccurate.
The student provides a very brief summary that misses key elements or includes personal opinions.
The student provides a summary of the text, but it may contain minor inaccuracies or omit some important details.
The student provides a generally objective summary of the text, including the main events and ideas.
The student provides a clear and objective summary of the text, accurately capturing the key events, characters, and ideas.
The student provides a concise, comprehensive, and objective summary of the text, demonstrating a thorough understanding of the material.
